body:
Hi guys! 
Thank you very much for the cool software!

I have a question. 
I installed self-hosted temporal.

But I see with tcpdump that it periodically goes online to Amazon IP addresses on port 443. 

What is this and how can I disable it?

Thanks !

comments.body:
Hello! 

Can you check if [Archival](https://docs.temporal.io/clusters#archival) feature is enabled and [setup](https://docs.temporal.io/self-hosted-guide/archival#set-up-archival) to use AWS S3?

Hello !

Thanks for your reply!
These options are disabled, but requests continue, usually when the server is restarted

archival:
  history:
    state: 'disabled'

namespaceDefaults:
  archival:
    history:
      state: 'disabled'

Looks like the question is already answered in our public slack channel. 

Just summarizing here. 
- It's a feature for checking if any new server version is available (UI will display new version info if there's one) and reporting minimal server info.
- The feature can be turned off by setting `frontend.enableServerVersionCheck` to false or `TEMPORAL_VERSION_CHECK_DISABLED` env var to true or 1.


The code doing this can be found [here](https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/main/service/frontend/version_checker.go).

title: Why Self-hosted Temporal-server periodically goes online to Amazon IP addresses on port 443.
